item.title: Pakistan reverses cricket T20 World Cup boycott and will face India in Sri Lanka
item.description: Pakistan has ‍agreed to play India ​in the ⁠T20 World Cup match scheduled to take ‌place in Colombo this ‍Sunday, February 15.

item.title: Former ATSIC head Geoff Clark was jailed but his community says legal issues persist
item.description: Former ATSIC leader Geoff Clark was jailed in 2024, yet some members of his community say legal issues linger on.

item.title: States urged to sign National Water Agreement even though users unaware what's in final version
item.description: As the country's state governments and territories consider signing a new national water policy that seeks to address climate change and elevate First Nations knowledge, the agricultural industry fears it has been overlooked.

item.title: Jake and Chris Waterman relishing prospect of AFL Origin as Perth prepares for Victorian invasion
item.description: WA's last State of Origin captain Chris Waterman is relishing the prospect of the concept's reboot — and can't wait to see his son Jake donning the famous black swan for the clash.

item.title: Ghislaine Maxwell was complicit in Jeffrey Epstein's abuse. Now she's pushing for clemency
item.description: Powerful socialite Ghislaine Maxwell was able to exploit her connections to recruit, groom, and abuse dozens of young girls. Now, she faces a fresh interrogation over her role in Jeffrey Epstein's abuse.

item.title: At school, I was my brother's protector. But I needed more support
item.description: I was my brother's protector at school, but the education system could have done more to support us both.

item.title: Craig Goodwin's World Cup hopes cop hammer blow after groin injury
item.description: He was one of the Socceroos best in Qatar but now Craig Goodwin will need a minor miracle to make this year's World Cup after the veteran suffered a groin injury for Adelaide United that will sideline him for some time.

item.title: Raymond Reddington murder trial hears Sharon Fulton seemed scared in hours before 1986 disappearance
item.description: A close friend of a woman allegedly murdered by her husband in Perth 40 years ago tells a Perth court she seemed frightened in the hours before her disappearance.

item.title: Health warnings about ultra-processed foods
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Celine Cremer search in Arthur River finds more bones and missing backpacker's car key
item.description: Tasmania Police say a car key found in the Arthur River has been "formally verified" as belonging to missing backpacker Celine Cremer.

item.title: Police warn against 'false hope' as cold case search bones identified as 'non‑human'
item.description: Bone fragments found during a private search for evidence relating to the disappearance of two girls in 1973 are "not human remains", according to police, who have issued a public warning against actions that create "false hope".

item.title: FBI releases surveillance pictures of masked man at Nancy Guthrie's home on morning she disappeared
item.description: FBI director Kash Patel has posted the images on social media, saying they had been recovered after days of work by investigators.

item.title: The Epstein files are shaking Britain, but Donald Trump could still have 3 million reasons to worry
item.description: Donald Trump's enemies made no secret of their hopes the documents would contain something explosive enough to bring the president down, but right now the Epstein spotlight is on Britain's politicians and palaces.

item.title: Food ministers move closer to mandating Health Star Ratings on packaged food
item.description: The nation's food ministers will this week take a crucial step towards mandating the Health Star Rating scheme on packaged food products.

item.title: How to reduce loneliness while working remotely
item.description: Working remotely can be a lonely experience. Here's what you can do about it.

item.title: Developers desert plans for new apartments in Sydney's west due to construction costs and interest rates
item.description: Industry peak bodies and economists blame mounting construction costs and rising interest rates for the stalling of new apartment projects in Western Sydney.

item.description: Despite a slew of key injuries leaving the Australian team unrecognisable, captain Mitch Marsh is confident about the experience left in the side.

item.description: Some of WA's oldest grass trees are being rescued from land clearing and development amid a population and property boom, preserving a unique part of the South West's natural heritage.

item.title: High Court finds Catholic Church liable for priest's sexual abuse but halves compensation
item.description: A man who suffered sexual abuse at the hands of a priest in the 1960s has won his High Court battle over liability, but had his compensation nearly halved.

item.title: Doongmabulla Springs decision leaves Qld government to weigh appeal or face trial
item.description: Wangan and Jagalingou peoples await the state government's next move after a win in their fight to have alleged damage to a sacred site near a mine in Central Queensland investigated.

item.title: What to watch in February, from puppy love to Muppet hijinks

item.description: As the frantic search for the mother of a well-known US journalist enters its 12th day, police have more questions than answers. Here's how it unfolded.

item.description: A new video filmed by a bystander and shared with ABC NEWS Verify shows the full minute before two police officers began punching a protester, shedding light on the beginning of the altercation.

item.title: Austin Appelbee's Triple Zero call to save family swept out to sea at Geographe Bay released
item.description: Police release the recording of the Triple Zero call made by 13-year-old Austin Appelbee after his marathon 4 kilometre swim through rough seas to save his family.

item.title: Australia cruises to victory over Ireland in T20 World Cup opener
item.description: Australia beats Ireland by 67 runs to win its first game at the T20 World Cup, after captain Mitch Marsh was a late out due to testicular bleeding.

item.title: More homes in Daly River damaged by flooding, with water levels expected to recede from Thursday
item.description: Floodwaters have spilled inside "quite a number of homes" in the remote Northern Territory town of Daly River, authorities say, with still-rising water levels delaying the return home for evacuated locals.

item.title: PM condemns 'white supremacy ideology' behind alleged Invasion Day terror attack
item.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has condemned the "racism and hatred" and "white supremacy ideology" behind the alleged terrorist attack on the Invasion Day rally in Borloo/Perth last month.

item.title: Thirty people stranded by floods in outback NT angry at police

item.title: Animal abuse charge takes one year as RSPCA prosecutions in Queensland drastically decline
item.description: A man has been charged with animal cruelty a year after neighbours first made a complaint to the RSPCA.

item.description: The Yolŋu artist known as the Fresh Prince of Arnhem Land is the king of feel-good bilingual bangers. But heavy is the crown.

item.description: The American actor was best known for his starring role as Dawson Leery in Dawson's Creek from 1998 to 2003.

item.description: An organisation that helps people caring for vulnerable family members in WA is experiencing unprecedented demand, with services unable to keep up with the community's needs.

item.description: As Port Hedland's controversial dust buyback scheme winds up, Pilbara Ports quietly walks away from major plans to build a training facility and accommodation, with development plans for the area still uncertain.

item.description: South Africa wins the most dramatic T20 World Cup group stage clash with Afghanistan, featuring two super overs and countless twists of fortune.

item.description: Mackay MP Nigel Dalton crossed the floor on Tuesday to vote with Katter's Australian Party to end a parliamentary ban on abortion debate.

item.title: Two Chinese nationals accused of foreign interference granted bail in ACT Magistrates Court
item.description: Police allege the two Chinese nationals, who are charged with reckless foreign interference for alleged spying on the Canberra branch of a Buddhist association, are linked to a woman arrested on the same charge last year.

item.description: Overnight thunderstorms left Central Australian rivers inundated on Thursday, with rapidly rising floodwaters submerging cars, ripping up trees and leaving multiple people stranded.

item.title: Toowoomba Hospital maternity unit to implement recommendations for workplace culture overhaul
item.description: Staff at the Toowoomba Hospital maternity unit will be implementing recommended changes to their workplace culture following an independent review.

item.description: The review of the Cairns paediatric gender health service found that children as young as 12 were given puberty blockers inconsistently and without formal consent.

item.description: With the ink still wet on a new hospital deal, state and territory health ministers will today use a meeting with their federal counterpart to call for urgent action on stranded patients.

item.title: Italy wins first T20 Cricket World Cup match as Australian-born players shine in 10-wicket win over Nepal
item.description: Sydney-born brothers Justin and Anthony Mosca have guided T20 World Cup debutants Italy to their first win in the tournament, as their unbeaten half-centuries secured a dominant 10-wicket victory over Nepal on Thursday.

item.description: Alexander Repin had been out of jail for four days when he consumed alcohol and drugs, then murdered an 89-year-old man in Lismore.

item.title: Katie Holmes pays tribute to Dawson's Creek co-star James Van Der Beek in handwritten letter
item.description: In a handwritten letter posted to social media, actor Katie Holmes has paid tribute to her Dawson's Creek co-star James Van Der Beek, who has died. He was 48.

item.description: Whether you've shed tears of joy, sadness or even laughter in the process, we want to hear it all — but keep it under 150 words.

item.description: The NT's small but mighty presence is shining on the global stage 40 years after Crocodile Dundee rocketed its film industry into the stratosphere.

item.title: Fortescue trials battery-electric locomotives in Pilbara as decarbonisation race tightens
item.description: After years of delays, the Pilbara's largest carbon emitters are testing greener ways to haul iron ore, and Andrew Forrest has now joined their ranks.

item.title: Supporting and connecting Deaf people, Olivia finds her calling more than just a job
item.description: Olivia Jackson, who lost her hearing as a child, has felt invisible for over a decade until she found her true calling to help other Deaf people achieve their goals as a support worker.

item.title: As Jakara Anthony dealt with her singles moguls crash, her coach worked out how to pick her back up
item.description: As Jakara Anthony dealt with the disappointment of her singles moguls crash, her coach Peter McNiel was working out how to pick her back up.

item.title: Gisèle Pelicot intends to visit ex-husband in prison to get answers on other allegations
item.description: Gisèle Pelicot, the woman at the centre of France's largest rape trial, says she intends to visit her ex-husband in jail and look her abuser "straight in the eye" to get answers to other allegations under investigation.

item.title: Man with stab wounds dies in Galiwin'ku after Elcho Island fight involving weapons, police say
item.description: A 27-year-old man has died in the Northern Territory after being stabbed during an armed fight with a 19-year-old, who has since been arrested.

item.title: 'Took the wind out of me': Why this man tested himself for plastics
item.description: Kal Glanznig had his urine tested as part of an upcoming documentary exploring plastic pollution in Australia. The results left him speechless.

item.title: Prime Minister announces $3.9 billion 'down payment' towards $30b Adelaide submarine shipyard
item.description: The South Australian and federal government release plans for the shipyard in Adelaide that will build at least eight nuclear-powered submarines under the AUKUS pact with the US and the UK.

item.title: Four boats destroyed in fire at Hillarys Boat Harbour, second blaze at marina in four months
item.description: Four boats are destroyed in a fire at Hillarys Boat Harbour, the second time a blaze has struck the marina in just over four months.

item.title: How China took over global car manufacturing
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Statues of Amy Sherwin, Australia's first opera star, unveiled at Hobart's Hadley's Hotel in bid to cement legacy
item.description: An effort to bring new recognition to a Tasmanian opera star who became world famous, but who died poor, culminates in the unveiling of two statues of her in Hobart.

item.title: e-bike rider suffers head injuries in crash after being followed by police in south-west Sydney as critical incident declared
item.description: A critical incident investigation is underway after a 39-year-old man being followed by police hit a pole, in what has been described as a "significant impact".

item.title: Charlotte Mortlock quits Liberal Party following Sussan Ley leadership defeat
item.description: Women were less likely to vote for the Coalition at the 2025 election than ever before, according to the Australian Election Study.

item.title: Indigenous and Māori All Stars play out dramatic 16-all draw
item.description: It went down to the final seconds, but the Indigenous and Maori NRL All Stars could not be separated with both sides left to rue missed chances after a 16-all draw.

item.title: Chinese star takes swipe at organisers for not accommodating her schedule
item.description: Chinese skiing superstar Eileen Gu says she is "disappointed" and "saddened" that Winter Olympics organisers scheduled halfpipe training at the same time as her big air final at the MIlano Cortina Games.

item.title: New Zealand's North Island braces for more rain amid widespread flooding
item.description: Floods cause power outages, road collapses, home evacuations and are linked to the death of a man whose vehicle was submerged on a highway.

item.title: City of Melbourne quiet on plan for Southbank's 'ugly' red stairs, long after design competition announced
item.description: A Melbourne council unveiled a lucrative competition to replace Southbank's much-derided red stairs. But a year after it was due to start, the plan appears to have gone nowhere.

item.title: This week in history quiz, February 16: Can you pass the test?
item.description: Abraham Lincoln's career advice, Karl Marx's co-author and a Hollywood star's surgery: How well do you know history?

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026: The anxiety and joy of dual moguls bronze for Matt Graham, leader and captain of the Australian team
item.description: Matt Graham's brilliant bronze in the dual moguls, and the incredible response from his teammates, proved to everyone that he is the true leader of this Winter Olympic squad.

item.title: Liberal Party divided over policy direction as Angus Taylor plots right-wing political shift
item.description: Angus Taylor says he will unite the Liberal Party, but a deeper rift is forming between those who want to overhaul the party's direction and those who believe doing so would mean political death.

item.title: ACCC takes Coles to court over 'illusory' discounts in 'case of the century'
item.description: The "case of the century" is set to play out in the federal court this month, with the ACCC taking on supermarket giant Coles for what it claims are "illusory" discounts.

item.title: Whooping cough cases hit record high after 'potentially catastrophic' vaccine rate drop
item.description: A "potentially catastrophic" decline in Australia's childhood vaccination rates has contributed to the sharpest increase in cases of whooping cough in 35 years, infectious diseases experts say.

item.title: As high-speed rail plans gather pace, Britain's HS2 offers hard lessons
item.description: While the federal government considers an ambitious plan, a similar project in the UK has seen its fair share of controversies.

item.title: Australia defeated by India in opening T20 as Sophie Molineux era gets off to wobbly start
item.description: Australia slumps to a rain-affected 21-run loss to India in their opening T20 at the SCG, after selectors opted to drop vice-captain Tahlia McGrath.

item.title: Box Hill North players' sanctions over inappropriate photos criticised as 'extremely lenient'
item.description: The Box Hill North Football Club players involved in inappropriate photos posted online after their "Silly Saturday" post-season celebrations have been sanctioned by the league's governing body.

item.title: Cousin of Westfield Bondi Junction attack victim feels many questions were left unanswered at inquest
item.description: A bereaved family member of victim Jade Young feels many of his questions surrounding the deadly attack and its aftermath have been left unanswered from the inquest.

item.title: Shark population may have fallen prey to algal bloom, SA ecologists fear
item.description: South Australia's algal bloom could be responsible for pushing a local population of sharks to the brink of collapse, some researchers say.

item.title: Cape Barren Island uses greenhouse and traditional foods to keep fridges full
item.description: A tiny island off the coast of Tasmania is embracing old and new techniques to keep food on the table.

item.title: 'Utterly misleading': ACCC argues case against Coles 'discounts', ASX marginally higher — as it happened
item.description: Supermarket giant Coles and the consumer watchdog are in the Federal Court. The ASX closes marginally higher after a busy session of results.

item.title: Taylor expected to reward allies with shadow cabinet positions within days — as it happened
item.description: Speculation is mounting over who will be promoted to the shadow cabinet after Angus Taylor's elevation to the leadership.

item.title: Flood warnings across Qld as the state's north braces for heavy falls
item.description: All eyes are on already-swollen waterways across Queensland as the state's north braces for another drenching this week.

item.title: NT MLA Tanzil Rahman accused of bullying two female staffers on VAD committee
item.description: A Northern Territory politician has been accused of bullying by two female staffers while leading a parliamentary committee, the ABC can reveal.

item.title: Rescuers race to find entangled whale last seen near Wilsons Promontory
item.description: Authorities are looking for a juvenile humpback whale last seen entangled in rope off the coast near Wilsons Promontory.

item.title: How the ABC Young Performers Awards helped launch the careers of these Australian musicians
item.description: The ABC Young Performers Awards have launched the careers of some of Australia's most successful musicians. Here are some of their stories.

item.title: Future of fishing prosecutions unclear after multi-million-dollar abalone trafficking case collapses
item.description: Subpoenaed documents obtained by the ABC reveal NSW Police continued prosecuting seven men for illegally trafficking abalone despite advice that their case was likely to fail.

item.title: Why Australian Adam Lambert's medal-losing crash in the final made him feel better about his Winter Olympics
item.description: Adam Lambert's crash in the mixed snowboard cross cost Australia a chance at a medal at the 2026 Winter Olympic Games, but it still makes him feel better about his campaign.

item.title: Queensland school teacher calls for endometriosis support after fundraising for surgery
item.description: After years of unsuccessful endometriosis treatments, Inez Goves underwent a hysterectomy thanks to an online fundraiser. But her symptoms returned, prompting more surgery and calls for greater support for the illness.

item.title: Sydney scientist collects wild roadside apples to produce cider
item.description: Lucien Alperstein has spent the past decade picking feral apples from trees along country back roads and making cider. They say their guerilla activity inspired their curiosity about the science of genetics and fermentation.

item.title: Chalmers mocks Taylor's proposal for bipartisan budget savings taskforce
item.description: Angus Taylor wrote to the prime minister pitching the plan just days after being elected leader of the Liberal Party.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026: Matt Graham on dual moguls 'dad podium' as weather forces reschedule — quick hits from day nine
item.description: A trio of dads fill the dual moguls podium as an "unfavourable" forecast leaves things up in the air. Here are the quick hits from day nine of the Milano Cortina Games.

item.title: Police make 'very strange' appeal for return of kidnapped 85yo Sydney man
item.description: Detectives believe Chris Baghsarian was mistakenly snatched from his bedroom just after 5am on Friday by intruders who forced their way into his North Ryde property.

item.title: Antarctic type B killer whales seen for first time near WA's Bremer Bay
item.description: Sightings of Antarctic orcas in Australian waters are very rare. A tour group in WA saw what appeared to be a pod of Antarctic type B killer whales muscle in and steal the meal of a local group of orcas.

item.title: Brett Pointing to replace Steve Gollschewski as Queensland police commissioner on 12-month interim basis
item.description: Brett Pointing has been named as the interim Queensland police commissioner after Steve Gollschewski announced his retirement.

item.title: New tobacco laws proposed by WA government to target stores selling illegal cigarettes, vapes
item.description: Western Australia could soon have some of the nation's toughest illegal tobacco penalties, including fines of up to $21 million and hefty prison terms for possessing commercial quantities of illicit products.

item.title: NRL opens door for New Zealand and England internationals to play State of Origin
item.description: New South Wales and Queensland can now select players who are New Zealand and England internationals after the NRL confirmed a major change to the State of Origin eligibility rules.

item.title: ACCC accuses Coles of 'planned' campaign to mislead customers
item.description: Supermarket giant Coles is accused of a "planned" campaign to mislead customers over discounts on the first day of a bombshell Federal Court case.

item.title: From the weird to the wonderful, here are nine times politicians have become a meme
item.description: From the downright weird to the speech that soared, Australia's politicians are under constant scrutiny. Here are some startling moments when the politician became the meme.

item.title: Man accused of Caboolture museum heist allegedly believed it was his 'duty' to return artefacts to 'rightful place', court told
item.description: Miguel Simon Mungarrieta Monsalve has been charged with a range of offences after he allegedly broke into a Caboolture museum on Friday morning.

item.title: 'Signal sniffers' used in search for missing person Nancy Guthrie's pacemaker
item.description: The FBI is using "sophisticated" technology to try to locate Nancy Guthrie's pacemaker, as the search for the mother of US TV host Savannah Guthrie enters its third week.

item.title: Hospital boss says changes already made at child gender service criticised in review
item.description: Advocates have called for for better regional services after a Cairns children gender clinic was restricted following a scathing report.

item.title: Perth Diving Academy Hillarys fined almost $20,000 after leaving two divers in ocean
item.description: Perth Diving Academy Hillarys is fined almost $20,000 after an Australian Maritime Safety Authority probe found it took the crew on board 10 minutes to realise two divers had been left behind.

item.title: Firearms charges laid amid search for Gus Lamont, SA Police say unrelated to disappearance
item.description: Detectives investigating the case of missing boy Gus Lamont have made an arrest during their renewed search for evidence – but say it does not relate to his disappearance.

item.title: Heat, storms lead to extreme fire forecast across dry Victoria tomorrow
item.description: Almost half the state is expected to face extreme fire conditions tomorrow due to a mix of heat, dry fuels and gusty afternoon storms.

item.title: Protester takes to roof of Geraldton fisheries building over WA government's demersal fishing ban
item.description: A Geraldton fisherman locks himself to the roof of a government building — and says he has swallowed the key — in a protest over Cook government restrictions.

item.title: How cheating allegations have rocked the curling teams at the Olympics
item.description: Controversy is swirling in curling at the Winter Olympics after the Canadian team was accused of cheating. Here's a look at the whole controversy and why it matters.

item.title: Wotjobaluk Nations and Tati Tati formally enter Victorian Treaty negotiations register
item.description: Wotjobaluk Nations and Tati Tati traditional owners have joined Victoria's formal Treaty negotiations register, building on decades of work towards recognition and self-determination.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026 quick guide: What to watch on Day 10
item.description: Find out what is on during Day 10 at the Winter Olympics in Milan.

item.title: Remote WA communities isolated and roads closed after weekend deluge
item.description: Major roads and remote communities are cut off by floodwaters after a deluge of rain in Western Australia's far north.

item.title: Gold Coast 'can't stop growth' but needs 185,000 new homes, according to council
item.description: The Gold Coast council plans to push more high-density housing inland to cope with a population surge to 1 million, amid warnings infrastructure is not keeping up.

item.title: Flotilla of foreign fishing boats spotted in Torres Strait waters
item.description: A surge in suspected illegal fishing activity puts the Torres Strait and Far North Queensland on high alert, with residents reporting multiple foreign vessels.

item.title: CLP announces Anjan Paudel as Nightcliff by-election candidate, Phil Scott runs as independent
item.description: More candidates for the Nightcliff by-election are announced, with Phil Scott running as an independent and the Country Liberal Party preselecting Anjan Paudel, who has stumbled while answering basic policy questions.

item.title: Former FBI agents say looking closer at Nancy Guthrie's social circle may be key to finding her
item.description: As the FBI continues searching for kidnapped 84-year-old Nancy Guthrie in the United States, a former FBI negotiator says they will be focusing on the grandmother's social circle and family.

item.title: Live: Women's curling kicks off day 10 of the Winter Olympics
item.description: Curling, alpine skiing and short-track skating are all on the agenda early in Milano-Cortina as the Winter Olympics continues. Follow live.

item.title: What happened to Nancy Guthrie?
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Australian women and children with links to ISIS forced to head back to camp in Syria
item.description: A group of Australian families with links to Islamic State fighters are forced to turn around after leaving a camp in Syria to try and begin their journey home to Australia.

item.title: New Coalition leader Angus Taylor denies knowledge of Ley immigration policy
item.description: Opposition Leader Angus Taylor says he does not know anything about Sussan Ley's proposed immigration policy and that "more supply" is key to solving Australia's housing crisis.
